page.title: 07WALDON FISH FARM
page.content: The farm was established in 1981. It supports a family of four. Markets include farm gate sales, hotels, restaurants, fish mongers and local markets. Fry are purchased from a hatchery on Exmoor. Rainbow trout are native to Canada and do not breed in Britain. Female brood fish are treated with male hormones thus producing milt also. Hence all fry are female. Fry are grown in tanks, then race-ways until one pound in weight (table preference). Those in excess are transferred to two man-made ponds (in total 2 acres) for fishing purposes. The density for this is 100 fish per acre. Predators include heron, magpies, kingfishers, mink and the occasional poacher. Frogs, water boatmen and dragonflies abound on the ponds.
